fields.summary: Integrity checker should remove invalid custom fields (i.e., fields with keys that cannot be found)

fields.description:
When the issue clause was being implemented, a decision was made to allow relational clauses on issue keys only, and not for issue ids.

I have discovered an edge case which highlights the need for relational clauses with issue ids. If you have a clause which is like so: {{issue < "HSP-1"}}, and you save this in a filter and share it with users who cannot see the HSP project, when they run the filter they will see this JQL query: {{issue < 10010}} (where {{10010}} is the issue id of {{HSP-1}}). This is due to sanitisation of issue clauses.

This will return no results as expected since they cannot see the project. However, if they go to edit the query, they will be presented with these error messages:
{quote}Issue '10011' could not be found for field 'issue'.
The field 'issue' does not support the relational operator '<' for issue IDs.{quote}

The first is valid, but the second I think would be confusing for the user.

So, we should allow relational searching on issue ids too. My suggestion to keep the results consistent is to lookup the issue key of the issue with the id, and then generate the same query as if the key were used.
fields.summary: Searching relationally on issue ids should be allowed

We have some customers demanding official support for Oracle JDBC drivers 10.2.0.4 or 10.2.0.5, as the current [documented|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/oracle.html] drivers (10.1.0.5) are very old.

We should run our functional tests against these drivers, and update the documentation once they are tested.

fields.description:
In JIRA4.0-m4, new lines in comments rendered using wiki markup are not always inserting black lines between paragraphs. They do generate

tags, just not the accompanying whitespace. I've attached screenshots of the same text on EAC and JAC. The text I was using: The problem with this is when we change the number for a room, it won't by tied to Zimbra and so it'll get out of sync. I'm prepared to bet that no-one will remember to manually change it either... Additionally, since the rooms have two phone numbers with no logical relation between them, you can't store both in the one phone number field Zimbra provides. Surely a better solution would be simply to make the Phone Extensions page more usable? *test*
fields.summary: Newlines in comments don't always work

fields.description:
Hi,

it will be really helpful if it ispossible to configure actions for the different Link Types, that will be called when one of the linked Issues gets a Resolution.

For Example:
If one Issue requires another Issue, than should this Issue only be resolvable AFTER the required Issue.
Duplicate Issues should be resolved when the duplicated Issue is resolved.

The actions could be:
Delete while Resolving, Resolve, Blocks

Regards
Christina
fields.summary: Linked Issues should perform actions when one issue is resolved

fields.description: When seraph sets cookie security, it looks only on scheme used by webserver and can't know about transparent proxy, which wraps servlet container running with insecure connection, with SSL or TLS. There are should some setting like force.secure.cookie.
fields.summary: Seraph alghoritm for setting secure cookies unrelated for transparent SSL proxy

fields.description:
When an issue is moved from one project to another, its subtasks also get moved to the new project.

If the new project uses an issue type scheme and workflow scheme that is different from the original project then subtasks need to be migrated.

1. In the MoveIssueUpdateWorkflow screen the wrong target workflow is displayed. Currently the parent issue's target workflow is being displayed, rather than the subtask's target workflow. (i.e. displays "Workflow Apple -> jira" rather than "Workflow Apple -> Workflow Bacon")
2. The list of target statuses is based on the parent issue's target workflow.
3. The subtask gets migrated to the parent issue's workflow. (i.e. after the move is complete the workflow actions are those of the parent issue's issue type rather than the subtask's issue type)
fields.summary: move issue w/subtask doesn't move subtasks between workflows + statuses properly
Implement Project Category clause for JQL

fields.description:
Velocity 1.4 has a bug in it so that local macro definitions can stomp on each other (in a multi threaded way) and invalidate the cached versions of these macros.

Once this happens parts of JIRA dont work properly and it cant be cleared until JIRA (and the velocity caches) are restarted.

We need to work around this problem by going through JIRA velocity macros and removing all local macros (and probably placing them into the global macro file)

We need to write unit test to scan for local macro definitions to prove they have all been found and removed and to stop them be re-introduced.
fields.summary: Remove local velocity macros definitions in JIRA

fields.description:
Some URLs are not protected by authentication which could expose some properties in JIRA that users may not wish to reveal.

Example 1: Searching filters

http://support.atlassian.com/secure/ManageFilters.jspa?filterView=search

Example 2: Viewing properties of filters.  I can see custom fields, search terms, etc. if they are used within the filter.

https://support.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=13244
fields.summary: Shared Filter properties exposed without authentication

fields.description:
When performing a quick search, search is done across all projects. If you just want to search a particular project you have to select it from the left hand filter.

There should be a way to save your "default" project, as is done by clicking on the Browse Projects tab, which searches your default project, removing the need for these annoying multiple clicks every time you want to quickly search your project.
fields.summary: Quick Search should remember your "default" project as Browse Project does

fields.description:
Hello,

yesterday our jira worked perfectly with the mylyn connector.
Today we needed 3 hours to find out that our jira version (Standard Edition, Version: 3.13.3-#344)
returns a wsdl that contains a RemoteServerInfo element with an serverTime subelement.

The symptom:
If I try to validate the connection in the mylyn connector dialog I get the error message "Invalid element in org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.jira.core.wsdl.beans.RemoteServerInfo -serverTime"
This Bug is reported at http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/newsLists/news.eclipse.tools.mylyn/msg01772.html.
The jira mylyn connector bugfix is included in the http://download.eclipse.org/tools/mylyn/update/extras/plugins/org.eclipse.mylyn.jira.core_3.1.1.v20090411-0400-e3x.jar plugin.

It seems that jira automatically retrieves the wsdl (and therefore updates to the wsdl) from somewhere because everything worked fine before yesterday.
We worked about one month with our mylyn jira connector and that jira version. We never made a update (neither mylyn nor jira). So where does this change come from??

Our solution:
We downloaded http://download.eclipse.org/tools/mylyn/update/extras/plugins/org.eclipse.mylyn.jira.core_3.1.1.v20090411-0400-e3x.jar.
Renamed it with the name of the current plugin in our installation and then replaced the current installation's plugin.
We are lucky that it is binary compatible :D

I know a bad workaround, but software development seems to be working around instead of targeting the real goals. ;)
fields.summary: Breaking WSDL API change

fields.description:
In example of service (POP3 mail handler) we don't mention a need of setting up the connection to mail server (outlined at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html ) .

In step 5 or 6 we should have a note saying  'ensure that you configure mailserver beforehand'

From the customer feedback:
{quote}
When an attempt is made to follow the docs below to add a pop handler:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/services.html

You are asked "Enter text values for service properties below. Any empty fields will be set to NULL in the Service's initialization. ".

You are asked for a number of values, using either dropdown boxes or text fields. The "server" value however offers no text field or drop down box, but instead gives the cryptic error "Could not find any values for field 'Server'. ".

The message gives the end user no clue at the course of action they must take to fix this error, and the docs make no clear reference that some vital step is required before any of this configuration is likely to work.

I could obviously do the standard waste-my-time-digging-in-google and eventually stumble upon the solution, but the real solution is for this error to be properly handled, not just sent out to an end user who has no clue what action is necessary to correct the error condition.
{quote}
fields.summary: Services page should mention setup of mail server connection

fields.description:
How do set up a custom field drop down list with multiple values by workflow?

For example, I have a custome field called "Reason" that has values: value1, value2 and value 3; and the same fieild is used in 3 different workflow screens. 

In woriflow screen1, the Reason field drop down shows value1, in screen2 shows value2, in screen3 shows value3.
fields.summary: Create a new feature for Custome Field to allow configuration of the same field with multiple values by differet workflow screens

fields.description:
Drag and drop behaviour doesn't work on Modify Issues Type Scheme page.  Using the mouse to drag and drop just highlights the text.  This functionality works in IE.  
This might be a 3rd party issue rather than a jira bug, but I don't know what might have changed in Firefox to produce this error.
fields.summary: Drag and drop behaviour doesn't work on Modify Issues Type Scheme page with Firefox 3.0.9

fields.description:
We added a new field (resolved) to the RemoteIssue in JIRA 4.0 which breaks backwards compatibility, however we're currently debating if we should not do this.

The options are basically this:
1. Don't break backwards compatibility and leave RemoteIssue as is.  If a client wants to get the resolution date they'll have to make a separate SOAP call (which sucks from a performance point of view)
2. Introduce a v3 of the SOAP interface which will basically be a copy of v2 but will also have things like the resolution date added.  Clients can choose to use the old v2 interface for backwards compatibility or upgrade to the new interface.  This sucks from a maintenance point of view for us though since a lot of code will be duplicated in the RPC plugin
3. We go with what we have now, basically breaking backwards compatibility and forcing all our clients to re-generate their SOAP client stubs.


Also we'll have to add this field to Jelly as well.
fields.summary: resolved field on RemoteIssue breaks backwards compatibility

fields.description:
The background colour of the unselected menu items seems to be hard-coded to the default light blue.
Similarly for the "highlight" background when you rollover on the head drop downs etc.
fields.summary: Look and Feel for some background colours in the header seems to be hard coded in v4.0 beta

fields.description:
Since we are working on revamping the JIRA Knowledge Base to make it more accessible perhaps it might be good to link to the Knowledge base in the [Troubleshooting section|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/apacheintegration.html#Troubleshooting]. 

The apache specific issues are located at:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/label/JIRAKB/apache
fields.summary: Link to the JIRA Knowledge Base in the Apache docs

The Polish team are having troubles with the WSDL of EACJ


Go to :

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/rpc/soap

Its shows a page like

And now... Some Services

          o getComment
          o createGroup
          o getSecurityLevel
          o getServerInfo
          o getGroup
          o createUser
          o getUser
          o getComponents
          o login
          o updateGroup
          o addUserToGroup
          o removeUserFromGroup
          o getIssue
          o createIssue
          o getAvailableActions
          o getConfiguration
          o createProject
          o updateProject
          o getProjectByKey
          o removeAllRoleActorsByProject
          o getPriorities
          o getResolutions
          o getIssueTypes
          o getStatuses
          o getSubTaskIssueTypes
          o getProjectRoles 

{code}

where is does not like to the wsdl like it should.  

It should response to an url like JAC does

http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl

fields.description:
After adding states to my workflow, I can successfully use them in the web interface, but certain states fail to show up in my SOAP client (Intellij Connector). Intercepting the SOAP request and response envelopes, it shows the Jira omits these transitions in its SOAP response.


The SOAP request envelope:

{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <ns1:getAvailableActions xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
      <in0 xsi:type="xsd:string">Yp86KFr7of</in0>
      <in1 xsi:type="xsd:string">TEST-97</in1>
    </ns1:getAvailableActions>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{noformat}

SOAP response ({{RequestReview}} action is missing):
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <ns1:getAvailableActionsResponse xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
      <getAvailableActionsReturn xmlns:ns2="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteNamedObject[3]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array">
        <getAvailableActionsReturn href="#id0"/>
        <getAvailableActionsReturn href="#id1"/>
        <getAvailableActionsReturn href="#id2"/>
      </getAvailableActionsReturn>
    </ns1:getAvailableActionsResponse>
    <multiRef xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns3="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" id="id1" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns3:RemoteNamedObject">
      <id xsi:type="xsd:string">2</id>
      <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Close
Issue</name>
    </multiRef>
    <multiRef xmlns:ns4="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" id="id2" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns4:RemoteNamedObject">
      <id xsi:type="xsd:string">4</id>
      <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Start
Progress</name>
    </multiRef>
    <multiRef xmlns:ns5="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" id="id0" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns5:RemoteNamedObject">
      <id xsi:type="xsd:string">5</id>
      <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Resolve
Issue</name>
    </multiRef>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{noformat}
fields.summary: SOAP returns invalid available state transitions
GroupPickerStatisticsMapper throws exception when used for charting

fields.description:
*Sympoms*
* E-mail attachments do not get added to created issues, especially when connecting to Exchange 2003 via IMAP.
* E-mail attachments do not get added to updated issues, especially when connecting to Exchange 2003 via IMAP.

The problem is that some E-mail servers (e.g. Exchange 2003) report MIME types in uppercase, for example, "MESSAGE/RFC822". JIRA does a case-sensitive comparison which makes it ignore these valid attachments. 

This has already been fixed in MAIL-43 which is included in 3.13.2 and above.
fields.summary: Attachments in E-mail not attached to issue on "Issue Creation from Email" or "Issue Update from Email"

fields.description:
E-mail notifications are not being sent out upon ticket creation for a project.

-Ticket creation is fine
-Workflow fires an "Issue Created" event for Create step
-Notification scheme set up to send notifications to ticket reporter and to myself upon creation of an issue
-Mail Queue remains empty after creating the ticket
fields.summary: Notifications are not being sent out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17017].
  {panel}

The following enhancements would be nice to have in watches list (UserWatches!default.jspa):
1/ Sort by columns - especially useful when you watch a lot of issues and you want to sort them by project, name or status.
2/ Bulk un-watch - for example to have checkboxes or something alike, in order to be able to un-watch more then one issue at once.
3/ Remembering on what page the browser was on watches list. For example when "un-watch" is clicked to be returned to the same page (if possible) or when issue is opened, and "return to" is clicked, to be returned to the same page of watch list.
4/ When you open an issue from Watches list, to have "Return to" link which to go back to watch list, not to latest search filter (not sure if bug or enhancement)
fields.summary: Return to the watches list after viewing an issue

fields.description:
Currently, translation of custom workflow transitions requires editing language pack files in order to set the relevant property keys - this is a bit cumbersome for the user who may want to define language translations from the UI while creating or editing the custom workflow.

It would be convenient to lookup these properties from the database (falling back to the language pack if not found) and to add a UI screen wherever a user is presented with the opportunity to enter a _Name_ and _Description_ to a custom object (Status, Step, Transition, Custom Field and so on...)

Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Add ability to translate (internationalise) custom workflow transitions (and possibly custom fields, statuses, etc...)

fields.description:
We have cases where we add purely integer values in custom fields containing only predefined options. However, when we sort the issues in the Issue Navigator they are sorted in alphabetical order.

Example:
Issues containing a field called severity having values 1,2,5,12,21 will be sorted 1,12,2,21,5 where it should logically have been sorted 1,2,5,12,21.

Suggestion:
Either automatically deduce that the field is purely integer and treat the values as integers when sorting.

or

Allow for user defined sorting algorithms. Possibly with predefined options such as alphabetical and numerical.
fields.summary: Numeric sort order for custom fields in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
Hi, 

This is Luke from Korean partner, Goldpitcher.
One of our customer requested to change user picker to multi-user picker when search screen.

With this request, we thought that it's more easier to search in case of serveral assignee users or report users at the same time.
It's possible to use with predefined group, but we think it's not efficient to make group for searching.

Please consider it and hope to include this feature.

Best Regards,
Luke
fields.summary: Change User Picker to Multi User Picker when searching

fields.description: When the target and destination project don't have the same set of assignable users we need to migrate the assignee field for issues and their subtasks. However, we currently popular the subtasks' dropdown with assignees from the current project rather than the destination project.
fields.summary: bulk move (and hence bulk migrate) of issue populates subtasks' assignee list with wrong users

fields.description:
When  "Accept Incoming Trackback Pings" is enabled and an issue has {{\-\-}} in a description near its start, the "{{\-\-\>}}" is displayed on the view issue screen. Checkout the screenshot.

I think that the "{{\-\-}}" in the description is confusing the Firefox parser into thinking that the comment around the "RDF" tag has ended before it actually has. We may need to escape the strings we add to the RDF attributes. Didn't know you can also have new lines in HTML attributes.
fields.summary: The '-->' is being displayed on the ViewIssue page when trackbacks enabled and description has "--" in comment.

fields.description:
Test Case:

# Create three versions 1, 2 and 3
# Create an issue and assign the Affects Version to 1 and the Fix version to 2
# Create a second issue and Assign Affects Version to 1 and Fix Version to 3 \\ \\
!Before Merge.jpg! \\ \\
# Merge version 1 & 2 into Version 3
# Some of the versions will be blanked out when they should all display version 3 \\ \\ 
!After Merge.jpg! \\ \\

I can reproduce this every time.
fields.summary: Merge Versions sometimes sets the wrong version
JIRA mail handler does not handle all attachments correctly

fields.description:
We need to provide a SOAP method for running a JQL string, this should be quite easy as we will just call off to the existing service.

We need to make sure we respect all the existing tempMax infrastructure when we do this so we don't try to return too many results.
fields.summary: Expose running JQL through SOAP API

fields.description:
We have put off functionally testing JQL we need to write a comprehensive suite of tests for this.

We need to check:
* the language
* validation errors
* the state transitions in the IssueNavigator
* everything else
fields.summary: Func test all of JQL

fields.description: Any remaining UI work for JQL.
fields.summary: UI work for JQL

fields.description:
This will need to happen when users have:

* Shown/hidden a field in a field configuration scheme
* deleted a custom field option
* changed the scope of a custom field
* deleted a custom field

There may be others, we need to think this through. 

The reason for this is that the index data will not be correct in these instances until the instance has been reindexed.
fields.summary: Admin section notifications used to alert admins they need to re-index their instance when changing field visibility and options

fields.description:
We need to change the way that we index issues so that we look at the field configuration when indexing and we do not index values for fields that are "hidden" in the issues context. This will allow JQL queries to be correct and not bring back data that the user has told us, through admin configuration, that they no longer think is relevant.

We need to change the IssueImpl does this same check and passes back null values for fields that are hidden. 

We want a consistent view of the data from all our objects, DocumentIssue and IssueImpl.
fields.summary: Indexing changes to support the EMPTY queries and to make the index "in-sync" with the database, includes changing the IssueImpl to only pass back field values that are "valid"

fields.description:
This is a clean up task that we can do once we have converted all the fields in JIRA we can remove all the SearchParameters.

This will mean deleting some old upgrade tasks which will mean putting in place a DB check to make sure that someone is not trying to upgrade to 4.0 from a really old version (one that would mean we need to run one of the upgrade tasks we deleted).

We should also be able to get rid of the LuceneQueryCreator since most of its logic is gone, the remaining logic should probably be done directly in the LuceneSearchProvider.

We also need to delete the old base classes and temporary proxy implementations that we have been using for the Searchers while we were converting.
fields.summary: Removing all references to SearchParameters, LuceneQueryCreator and refactoring the Issue/CustomFieldSearchers to conform to the new interface.

fields.description:
We need to use all our XML handlers to create an upgrade task that will convert all existing saved filters to JQL strings.

The XML handlers are done and tested and should make this easier.

We need to test this with real world data and be very careful.
fields.summary: Upgrade task to convert all existing saved searches into JQL + real world data tests

fields.description:
We need to make a better pass at our parser error messages and see if we can make them a bit more user friendly.

We also need to evaluate our current error messages in relation to functions, I think we need to not show the values that functions create and limit the message to only saying that the function provided an illegal value.
fields.summary: Robust error reporting for the JQL including, if possible, the line/column number of the syntax error

fields.description:
Currently a plugin developer will need to provide both a CustomFieldSearcher and a CustomFieldClauseHandler when extending searching in JIRA. This is because the current plugin point in JIRA is Searcher based. 

With JQL the core of searching is really the clause handler and it would be cool if users could extend searching here without having to provide the simple navigator support. This can only be done if we change the plugin point to allow to only provide ClauseHandlers and an optional searcher. 

We would need to create an upgrade task that will convert all the old CustomFieldSearcher configurations to the new SearchHandler.

This is not a trivial change and is currently an optional task.
fields.summary: Refactor the CustomFieldSearcher plugin point to be the SearchHandler interface (includes ClauseHandler and Searcher)

fields.description:
I started with the administrator's dashboard.
* Made it three-column.
* Added an external gadget (http://hosting.gmodules.com/ig/gadgets/file/117695765658379330528/WordPress-dot-comRSSFeed.xml)
* Configured custom options in the above external gadget.
* Added another instance of the same external gadget.
* Configured custom options in second instance of gadget.
* Moved gadgets around on Dashboard.

Now tried to copy the dasbhoard
* Clicked "Tools --- Copy Dashboard".
* Entered options - new dashboard name and description.
* Added a share for "Everyone"
* Clicked "add".
* Crash.

I've just repeated the second set of steps above, and it's given the same error.

The URL of the crash is:
http://threesheets:8090/jira/secure/AddPortalPage.jspa

Cheers
Sarah
fields.summary: Cloning dashboard doesn't seem to work with the new dashboard (perhaps due to 3 column layouts)
Unable to set transition property "jira.i18n.submit"

fields.description:
The WSDL describes a type of  AbstractRemoteObject which is the base type of RemoteIssue. In the SOAP response the id value from AbstractRemoteObject is incorrectly placed in the middle of  values represented by the <sequence> block in RemoteIssue. This breaks the sequence and causes the SOAP response to be incorrectly/incompletely processed by clients with a strict interpretation of the <sequence> block.

SOAP Request:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:soap="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
   <soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <soap:getIssue soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
         <in0 xsi:type="xsd:string">eFor7al09k</in0>
         <in1 xsi:type="xsd:string">LD-7</in1>
      </soap:getIssue>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

Response:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
   <soapenv:Body>
      <ns1:getIssueResponse soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <getIssueReturn href="#id0"/>
      </ns1:getIssueResponse>
      <multiRef id="id0" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns2:RemoteIssue" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns2="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
         <affectsVersions soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteVersion[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array">
            <affectsVersions href="#id1"/>
         </affectsVersions>
         <assignee xsi:type="xsd:string">rtls071</assignee>
         <attachmentNames soapenc:arrayType="xsd:string[0]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array"/>
         <components soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteComponent[0]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array"/>
         <created xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2008-11-12T13:59:20.163Z</created>
         <customFieldValues soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteCustomFieldValue[0]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array"/>
         <description xsi:type="xsd:string">This describes the issue</description>
         <duedate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-04-29T04:00:00.000Z</duedate>
         <environment xsi:type="xsd:string">OS-X</environment>
         <fixVersions soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteVersion[2]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array">
            <fixVersions href="#id2"/>
            <fixVersions href="#id3"/>
         </fixVersions>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10073</id>
         <key xsi:type="xsd:string">LD-7</key>
         <priority xsi:type="xsd:string">3</priority>
         <project xsi:type="xsd:string">AB</project>
         <reporter xsi:type="xsd:string">rpyt021</reporter>
         <resolution xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
         <status xsi:type="xsd:string">3</status>
         <summary xsi:type="xsd:string">Edit Module Dep</summary>
         <type xsi:type="xsd:string">6</type>
         <updated xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-04-20T21:03:06.174Z</updated>
         <votes xsi:type="xsd:long">0</votes>
      </multiRef>
      <multiRef id="id2" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns3:RemoteVersion" xmlns:ns3="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
         <archived xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</archived>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10031</id>
         <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Iteration 0.2</name>
         <releaseDate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-02-02T05:00:00.000Z</releaseDate>
         <released xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</released>
         <sequence xsi:type="xsd:long">3</sequence>
      </multiRef>
      <multiRef id="id3" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns4:RemoteVersion" xmlns:ns4="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
         <archived xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</archived>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10053</id>
         <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Iteration R1</name>
         <releaseDate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime" xsi:nil="true"/>
         <released xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</released>
         <sequence xsi:type="xsd:long">25</sequence>
      </multiRef>
      <multiRef id="id1" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns5:RemoteVersion" xmlns:ns5="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
         <archived xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</archived>
         <id xsi:type="xsd:string">10056</id>
         <name xsi:type="xsd:string">Pre-work</name>
         <releaseDate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2008-12-31T05:00:00.000Z</releaseDate>
         <released xsi:type="xsd:boolean">false</released>
         <sequence xsi:type="xsd:long">1</sequence>
      </multiRef>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
fields.summary: Sequence of returned values doesn't match WSDL for getIssue SOAP request

fields.description: In our JIRA instance both customers and developers have access to issues. We would like to have a security scheme functionality in connection to issue's attachments. In other words, we would like to attach a documentation which would not be visible to customers or other groups of JIRA users.
fields.summary: Issue attachments, need a functionality of Security Schemes

fields.description:
hello,

currently when trying to assign a ticket to a person, you need to go through the drop down menu list of the people. can we not have also there on the side, the names of the participants? so that you can click them to assign to them the issue? this will be much faster when it comes to dealing with lots and lots of tickets to assign back. 

thanks
T
fields.summary: Assign ticket feature

fields.description:
When executing the func test TestCsvImport.testMedium() you will see a stack trace in the jira log, complaining about Assertions$NullArgumentException: avatarId should not be null!
This exception is thrown every time you view the imported project via '/browse/GDL', because the JSP is trying to evaluate the value expression '/project/avatar'.

Either the import should create a valid avatar for the project, if none is provided or the AvatarManager should be able to handle a null value for an avatar.
fields.summary: Project CSV import causes avartar id to be null
Refactor select and multi-select searcher and JQL classes to handle case insensitivity properly.
Add the ability to browse a project by 'Affects Version'

fields.description:
To replicate this problem:

# Create a new 3.13.3 or 3.13.2 instance
# Setup a project with Time Tracking on and create an issue and set some time tracking
# Create the report based on the documentation - http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/timetracking_report.html

The report's URL in the browser are correct but the URL in the Excel output is as follows:

* *http://10.60.1.148:8099/browse/AAA-1* compared to *file:///browse-AAA-1*
fields.summary: Exporting Time Tracking Report gives wrong URLs
Inconsistent behaviour when administrator does not have the "JIRA Users" global permission

fields.description:
If you look at 3.13.3's document for [Editing a Workflow scheme|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/activating_workflow.html#schemes], step 4. suggests users to click *Edit* which simply edits the description of the workflow scheme.

For the correct procedure, please see 3.11's [version|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/activating_workflow.html#schemes].
fields.summary: Instructions for editing Workflow Scheme incorrect

fields.description:
Sometimes list of filtered issues in this portlet can be quite long - hundreds rows, whereas rows of interest are 10-20-30 rows usually.
Would be very good to have *Number to Show* option to limit number of rows returned in the portlet, same as I can do it in *Two Dimensional Filter Statistic* portlet.
fields.summary: Option "Number to Show" in Filter Statistics Portlet to limit numer of rows displayed
Do not allow a plugin that registers components with pico to be disabled or enabled - JIRA needs to be restarted
Requesting new feature , reading HTML, in Jira

fields.description:
Login Gadget works when I run Java 5, but under Java 6 I get an error saying "Gadget spec located at 'gadgets/login.xml' is not valid".

I am running 64bit java version "1.6.0_07" on Linux.
fields.summary: Login Gadget throws an error when I run JIRA under Java 6
Support for current web item aware decorators on admin screen
After moving issue continue to create links to it but with proper location

fields.description:
Logicaly SimpleVelocityRequestContext (implementor of VelocityRequestContext) should be created by factory, which pass an appProperties with seted jira.baseurl property.
But what we have? RequestCleanupFilter calls forced caching of SimpleVelocityRequestContext with Server Context Path as BaseURL. If you mention contextPath is not the same in coyote as scheme + host + port + contextPath.

In this case jira.baseurl property is useless and makes me debug my instance in a hour. The reason is what in my email notifications issue urls looks like /browse/KEY-NUMBER
fields.summary: BaseUrl is always empty

fields.description:
I think there's a lot of value to JIRA providing evidence-based scheduling feature, either as part of JIRA, or as a plugin. 

See the rationale in practice here: http://www.joelonsoftware.com/items/2007/10/26.html
FogBugz has this feature, which is really neat: http://www.fogcreek.com/FogBugz/learnmore.html#hist_PredictShipDates
fields.summary: Evidence-based scheduling support

fields.description: Please see RELENG-258
fields.summary: JIRA 3.13.3 Maven artifacts do not match those on WAC

fields.description:
When you enter an email address via the web interface you can enter extra whitespace:

{noformat}
select *, length(propertyvalue) from propertystring where propertyvalue like '%amyers@atlassian.com%';
+-------+-----------------------------+-----------------------+
| ID    | propertyvalue               | length(propertyvalue) |
+-------+-----------------------------+-----------------------+
| 10012 | amyers@atlassian.com        |                    27 | 
| 10032 | amyers@atlassian.com        |                    20 | 
+-------+-----------------------------+-----------------------+
{noformat}

This can cause problems with email handlers since the user will not get found if their email address has extra whitespace.
fields.summary: Trim email addresses
